intro: Pseudeminia benguellensis, commonly known as the Benguella spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
